author: Gautam S
text:
Personnel from the Mumbai police in plain clothes will mingle with Holi revellers.— Photo: LINGARAJ PANDA

If you see a Holi reveller acting a bit aloof or preoccupied with scant regard for the festivities around him, chances are that he is a policeman in plainclothes.

To keep a better check on anti-social elements, who strike at crowded spaces, and to prevent sabotage in the terror-sensitive climate, Mumbai police personnel will mingle with Holi revellers on Thursday.

“Our personnel will mingle with the crowds, particularly at open spaces and promenades, where revellers from all over gather to celebrate Holi,” said Joint Commissioner of Police (Law and Order) Deven Bharti.

Police officials said many cases of theft occur on occasions like Holi, as anti-social elements take advantage of the large crowds. Every year, revellers find their wallets and cell phones missing.

“The large crowds are also soft targets for terrorist elements,” said an officer.

All-woman squads

The other major concern is molestation of women. “We will also have special all-woman squads deployed all over the city. Women can approach these squads for help,” Mr. Bharti added.

The police will step up patrolling in the city from Wednesday night, and random checks of vehicles will be conducted to seize contraband. Anti-terror cells of all police stations had been instructed to keep their ears to the ground, the police said.

Plainclothesmen and all-woman squads to be deployed across the city
title: Mumbai police to step up security for Holi
